mainText.attr1: Enter Command Mode - AND - Toggle Turret Groups- KEY -
Mouse look to turn maneuvering mode
Ship in the way - move up/down the camera
Zoom in and out via the mouse wheel
Use time dilation while targeting enemies or issuing orders

Many space sims have turret modes. Some even have multi turret modes - and this is where the idea of command mode originated. The unique perspective and ease of use led me to the obvious conclusion that this mode would be great for controling the ship as well (not just its turrets). I always wanted capital ships to be included in the game and be pilotable - but I didn't want them to be simply larger/slower versions of fighters. Command mode is my attempt at that goal.

So here you can cycle turret groups - to manually fire or have them auto fire via the F5 key (by default). You can toggle manual aim or auto track via the SHIFT +A key (by default). You can have the ship maneuver where the view is oriented via the M key (by default).

All other ship functions work the same, including speed settings, manual thrusts. You can also toggle crew control via F6 (by default) and then use a turret group. How you want to control the ship is up to you.
Don't forget, this mode is available in any ship. Try it out in a fighter - press M (by default) to enable maneuvering.
